page.title: 07Local History,Swindon.
page.content: This urban area has at its centre the ancient village of Hreod Burna meaning red or reed stream.The stream still runs through a pleasant grassy area maintained by the council.Its modern name is Rodbourne Cheney.The Cheney family owned the{manor}after the Norman Conquest.The sixteenth Century manor house and part of the village green survive surrounded by newer developments.The{medieval parish {church}of St Marys is now by the council estate of Moredon built in the early 1950s.Part of the old{Saxon cross is built into the wall of the church tower.In Victorian times clay was dug in nearby Plummers Pit to be made into bricks.These were used for building in the expanding railway town of Swindon.
